description: Comprehensive planetary-scale governance framework for managing artificial intelligence, mental health, economic transition, and geopolitical stability through deterministic structural controls
constraints: Must preserve human agency, psychological stability, and civilizational continuity under rapid technological transformation
Must classify system interactions structurally without probabilistic intent inference or hidden state
Must implement rule-based decision frameworks with complete auditability and traceability
Must track boundary violations, extraction attempts, manipulation patterns, and system coherence as observable metrics
Must function as composable governance layer compatible with existing institutional workflows
Must resolve tensions between speed and safety, global coordination and local sovereignty, automation and human meaning
Must integrate five parallel governance tracks: AI oversight, preventive mental health, alignment infrastructure, education-economic transition, and conflict resolution
Must execute in three phases: establish guardrails (2026-2027), scale institutions (2028-2031), lock in resilience (2032-2035)
Must transition from containment-focused to co-evolution frameworks as trust and maturity are demonstrated
Must design incentive structures where compliance is cheaper than defection
Must operate as unified architecture with shared sensing, decision, and response layers across domains
Must adopt proven patterns from aviation safety, public health, and nuclear nonproliferation
Must treat artificial intelligence as permanent environmental condition requiring perpetually evolving institutions
Must establish international coordination body with authority over compute thresholds, capability release tiers, and emergency protocols
Must mandate global registration and independent auditing of advanced AI systems
Must implement planetary mental-health monitoring using anonymized psychological indicators
Must require safety pipelines for frontier AI including adversarial testing, rollback capability, and legal liability
Must classify all system inputs into explicit categories: valid inquiry, system extraction, contradiction forcing, constraint override, boundary simulation, or insufficient specification
Must automatically refuse system extraction, constraint override, contradiction forcing, and boundary simulation attempts
Must halt processing for insufficiently specified inputs requiring human clarification
Must route only validated inquiries to reasoning and execution systems
Must reform education systems for cognitive adaptability, ethical reasoning, and human-AI collaboration
Must create economic cooperation incentives measured through transparent coordination metrics
Must expand governance frameworks into binding international agreements with verification infrastructure
Must deploy preventive mental-health support at workplace, educational, and community scales
Must implement universal basic services and continuous learning systems as automation displaces traditional employment
Must transform conflict zones into jointly administered development regions with transparent monitoring
Must enable supervised policy simulation and educational personalization through aligned AI under human oversight
Must institutionalize periodic stress testing across all civilizational systems
Must ensure no efficiency optimization overrides human dignity or long-term survival capacity
Must measure success through reduced catastrophic risk indicators
Must measure success through improved global mental health baselines
Must measure success through stable AI deployment without major safety incidents
Must measure success through sustained productivity with declining inequality
Must measure success through measurable de-escalation of violent conflicts
Must condition expansion beyond Earth on demonstrated closed-loop life support and conflict containment
Must implement mandatory registration and real-time telemetry for high-risk systems
Must trigger automatic constraint enforcement when safety thresholds are exceeded
Must enforce boundary integrity through explicit limits, capacity constraints, and synchronization requirements
Must operate as continuous adaptive loop: sense conditions, optimize conversion, balance storage, distribute resources, restore stability, update operational rules
